89  BaseStat::BaseStat(std::string n) :
90  _name(n)

92  _statList.push_back(this);

100  void BaseStat::init(size_t n)
101  {
102  _totalNumOfExp = n;
103  _endOfSim = false;
104  _initFlag = true;
105  for_each(_statList.begin(), _statList.end(),
106  mem_fun(&BaseStat::init));
107  }

109  void BaseStat::init()
110  {
111  _exper.clear();
112  _expNum = 0;
113  }

115  void BaseStat::setTransitory(Tick t)
116  {
117  _transitory = t;
118  }

120  bool BaseStat::chkTransitory()
121  {
122  if (SIMUL.getTime() >= _transitory) return false;
123  else return true;
124  }
125 
126  double BaseStat::t_student(int alfa, int dol)
127  {
128  if (dol<1 || dol>30)
129  return -1;
130  switch (alfa) {
131  case 90:
132  return t1_table[dol-1][0];
133  break;
134  case 95:
135  return t1_table[dol-1][1];
136  break;
137  default:
138  return -1;
139  }
140  }
141 
142  //
143  // Collect all the results
144  //
145  void BaseStat::endRun()
146  {
147  for_each(_statList.begin(), _statList.end(),
148  mem_fun(&BaseStat::collect));
149  if (++_expNum >= MAX_RUN)
150  throw Exc(TOO_MUCH_RUNS);
151  }
152 
153  void BaseStat::endSim()
154  {
155  _endOfSim = true;
156  }
157 
158  //
159  // Initialize all the stat objs and increment expnum
160  //
161  void BaseStat::newRun()
162  {
163  for_each(_statList.begin(), _statList.end(),
164  mem_fun(&BaseStat::initValue));
165  }
166 
167  //
168  // Returns the mean value calculated over all the experiments
169  //
170  double BaseStat::getMean()
171  {
172  if (!_endOfSim) throw Exc(GET);
173  if (!_initFlag) throw Exc(NO_INIT);
174 
175  double sum = accumulate(_exper.begin(), _exper.end(), 0.0);
176  sum /= _expNum;
177 
178  return sum;
179  }
180 
181  //
182  // Returns the semi-confidence interval
183  // (the mean vary in [mu - sci; mu + sci]) relative to prob (1 - a)
184  //
185  namespace {
186  // Functor to use with accumulate() in order
187  // to evaluate the variance:
188  // sigma^2 = Sum( (exper[i] - _mu)^2 ) / N*(N-1)
189  // being N the number of rounds
190  class V {
191  double _mu;
192  public:
193  V(double m) : _mu(m) {}
194  double operator()(double result, double value) const
195  {
196  return result + (value - _mu)*(value - _mu);
197  }
198  };
199  }
200 
201  //
202  // Returns the variance for the experimental samples
203  //
204  double BaseStat::getVariance()
205  {
206  double sum = 0;
207  double mu; // the mean
208 
209  if (!_endOfSim) throw Exc(GET);
210  if (!_initFlag) throw Exc(NO_INIT);
211  if (_expNum < 3) throw Exc(NEED_3);
212 
213  mu = getMean();
214 
215  sum = accumulate(_exper.begin(), _exper.end(), 0.0, V(mu));
216  return sqrt(sum/((_expNum - 1) * _expNum));
217  }
218 
219  double BaseStat::getConfInterval(CONFIDENCE_INTERVAL c)
220  {
221  double mu; // the mean
222  double s; // the variance
223 
224  if (!_endOfSim) throw Exc(GET);
225  if (!_initFlag) throw Exc(NO_INIT);
226  if (_expNum < 3) throw Exc(NEED_3);
227 
228  mu = getMean();
229  s = getVariance();
230  return t_student(c, (unsigned int) _expNum - 1) * s;
231  }
232 
233  void BaseStat::printAll()
234  {
235  for_each(BaseStat::begin(), BaseStat::end(), mem_fun(&BaseStat::print));
236  }
237 
238  void BaseStat::print()
239  {
240  cout << "[" << getName()
241  << "]:" << getMean()
242  << " (Conf[95%]=" << getConfInterval(BaseStat::C95)
243  << ")"
244  << endl;
245  }
246 
247  /* Output class
248  This class produce formatted output to be read by gnuplot.
249  Just call GnuPlotOutput::init() before simulation, and
250  GnuPlotOutput::write("%f", par) after every simulation, where
251  par is a float parameter of the simulation.
252  There can be more than one parameter, and of different types!
253 
254  See ex7.ccp for more details.
255  */
256  void GnuPlotOutput::init()
257  {
258  BaseStat::List::const_iterator i = BaseStat::begin();
259  while (i != BaseStat::end()) {
260  BaseStat* p = *i;
261  cout << "Name: " << p->getName() << endl;
262 
263  if (p->getName() != "") {
264  ofstream f(p->getName().c_str());
265 
266  if (!f.is_open())
267  throw Exc("Cannot open file " + p->getName());
268 
269  f << "# " << p->getName() << endl;
270  }
271  ++i;
272  }
273  }
274 
275  /* Output class
276  This class produce formatted output in a table-like format.
277  Every statistic has its own line with:
278  - name of the statistic;
279  - average value
280  - confidence interval
281 
282  The init method takes the file name.
283 
284  The write() method takes a string that will be
285  printed at the beginning of the file.
286  */
287 
288  void TableOutput::init(string filename)
289  {
290  if (!_created)
291  _fname = filename;
292  _created = true;
293  }
294 
295  void TableOutput::write(string message)
296  {
297 
298  if (!_created)
299  throw BaseExc("Init function not called",
300  "TableOutput",
301  "basestat.cpp");
302 
303  ofstream f(_fname.c_str());
304  f << message << endl;
305 
306  BaseStat::List::const_iterator i = BaseStat::begin();
307  BaseStat* p = *i;
308  while (p != NULL) {
309  f << p->getName() << "\t\t | "
310  << p->getMean() << "\t\t | "
311  << p->getConfInterval() << endl;
312  ++i;
313  p = *i;
314  }
315  }
316 }

325 using namespace MetaSim;

327 // only for debug!!
328 
329 class Dummy : public StatMean {
330  NormalVar nv;
331 public:
332  Dummy(int v) : StatMean("StatMean",0), nv(v, 1) {};
333  virtual void probe(Event *e) { record(nv.get()); }
334  virtual void attach(Entity* e) {}
335 };
336 
337 Dummy *d1;
338 Dummy *d2;
339 
340 int main()
341 {
342  int n;
343  int i,j;
344 
345  try {
346  cout << "Insert n (n > 3): ";
347  cin >> n;
348  BaseStat::init(n);
349 
350  d1 = new Dummy(7);
351  d2 = new Dummy(10);
352 
353  for (j = 0; j < n; j++) {
354  for (i = 0; i < 1000; i++) {
355  d1->probe(0);
356  d2->probe(0);
357  }
358 
359  BaseStat::endRun();
360 
361  if (j < n-1) BaseStat::newRun();
362  }
363 
364  BaseStat::printall();
365  } catch (exception& e) {
366  cout << "Exception: " << e.what() << endl;
367  }
368 
369 } // namespace MetaSim
370 
371 #endif // __TEST__
